comment.text: May act as an inducible transporter in the biliary and intestinal excretion of organic anions. Acts as an alternative route for the export of bile acids and glucuronides from cholestatic hepatocytes (By similarity).

isoform.name: MRP3A
isoform.text: May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

isoform.name: MRP3B
isoform.text: May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

isoform.name: MRP3S1
isoform.text: May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay. No experimental confirmation available.

comment.text: Mainly expressed in the liver. Also expressed in small intestine, colon, prostate, testis, brain and at a lower level in the kidney.
Belongs to the ABC transporter superfamily. ABCC family. Conjugate transporter (TC 3.A.1.208) subfamily.

comment.name: ABCMdb
comment.text: Database for mutations in ABC proteins

property.value: Recycling of bile acids and salts
F:ATPase activity, coupled to transmembrane movement of substances
P:bile acid and bile salt transport
